{"step_by_step_thinking": "Myocardial infarction (MI) is a condition that can be diagnosed using various biomarkers. These markers are released into the bloodstream following damage to the heart muscle. The timing of their release varies. CPK-MB is usually one of the first markers to rise, followed by Troponin T and Troponin I. LDH (Lactate Dehydrogenase) is typically the last marker to rise following an MI.", "answer_choice": "A"}
